intro: Erica diosmifolia, commonly known as the coastal heath or coastal Erica, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is adapted to coastal conditions with high salt exposure and strong winds. Erica diosmifolia is often used in coastal landscaping due to its hardiness and ornamental value.
